title: Jean-Pierre schooled online after ‘bad answer’ to Doocy’s question about her own ‘stolen election’ rhetoric
description: Karine Jean-Pierre took heat online after dismissing Fox News reporter Peter Doocy's question about her old tweets claiming that the 2016 election was stolen.

title: NYC Mayor Adams sends delegation to southern border amid clash with Texas Gov. Abbott over migrant buses
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams' office sent a delegaton to the southern border to get "real answers" about the busing of migrants from Texas to the Big Apple.

title: Steelers to retire Franco Harris' number for 50th anniversary of Immaculate Reception
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers announced on Tuesday that the team will retire Franco Harris' 32 on Dec. 24, one day after the 50th anniversary of the Immaculate Reception.

title: Motorcyclist in Delaware dies in crash caused by SUV making U-turn
description: A motorcyclist was killed in Delaware when a 71-year-old SUV driver attempted to make a U-turn and knocked the motorcyclist off of the bike.

title: South Dakota man in custody following fatal shooting at ex-girlfriend's apartment
description: A 38-year-old South Dakota man is in custody after killing a man at his ex-girlfriend's apartment in Sioux Falls. The shooter was arrested at 5 a.m. on Tuesday.

title: Indiana 4-year-old girl's body found in pond
description: The body of a missing 4-year-old child in Indiana was found at a pond in central Indiana. Volunteers spent hours searching for her on Thursday and Friday.

title: Seahawks' Pete Carroll dismisses doubters in the wake of Russell Wilson's absence
description: The Seattle Seahawks are expected to be even worse than their 7-10 record last season with Russell Wilson being traded, but head coach Pete Carroll doesn't see that for his club.

title: 'Don't Worry Darling' star Harry Styles 'did not' spit on Chris Pine: 'Foolish speculation,' rep says
description: "Don't Worry Darling" star Harry Styles was accused of spitting on Chris Pine before the screening of Olivia Wilde's movie at the Venice Film Festival Monday.

title: NBC News report highlights 'messy' rollout for Biden's student loan debt plan: 'Trying to do too much'
description: NBC News reported on Monday that the rollout of Biden's student loan debt handout "could get messy" and that they were doing too much in a short time frame.

title: ND Democratic candidate drops out after former Miss America Cara Mund enters US House race
description: Cara Mund, who entered the U.S. House race in December, has caused the Democratic candidate to drop out of the race. Mark Haugen said he didn't see a path to winning.

title: Pornhub rips anti-trafficking org as 'anti-porn zealots' following Instagram account suspension
description: Pornhub ripped an anti-sex trafficking nonprofit that advocated for them to be banned from Instagram amid allegations that the online porn giant profits from sexual abuse.

title: White House hints Americans will need annual COVID boosters
description: The Biden administration signaled Tuesday that the COVID-19 vaccine booster could be viewed similar to an annual flu shot.

title: Washington police fatally shot a man armed with rifle
description: A Washington man, who had an anti-harassment order against him, was killed by the Spokane police after he armed himself with an AR-15-style rifle.

title: Jackson, Mississippi, water pressure is restored to 'normal' for most residents
description: Jackson, Mississippi, officials said Monday that water pressure has returned to normal for most of its residents. The capital city is still under a boil water notice.

title: Kim Kardashian bares her backside for racy magazine cover, explains why she can relate to women behind bars
description: In a provocative "Interview" magazine cover baring her bum, Kim Kardashian talks about how she was just a few steps away from getting in trouble over "dumb s---," implying she could be one of the many incarcerated women who are serving time for violent crimes they committed for a man.

title: Eliza Fletcher kidnapping: Memphis police find tire track marks, 'odor of decay' in search for Tennessee mom
description: Memphis police and other law enforcement officials traced "tire marks" and an "odor of decay" to find the body of missing Eliza Fletcher.

description: Memphis police and other law enforcement officials traced "tire marks" and an "odor of decay" to find the body of missing Eliza Fletcher.

title: Justin Bieber cancels Justice World Tour: 'I need to make my health the priority'
description: Justin Bieber announced he was canceling the rest of his Justice world tour to focus on his health. The pop star was diagnosed with Ramsay Hunt syndrome in June.

title: Volunteers located a photo of every service member whose name is listed on the Vietnam Veterans Memorial
description: A group of volunteers located a photo of every service member whose name is listed on the Vietnam Veterans Memorial after 21 years. People can still submit photos of those on the wall.

title: Trial for 2016 'Pike County Massacre' delayed 1 week
description: The initial jury trial in the "Pike County Massacre" case has been delayed for a week due to someone involved with the proceedings falling ill.

title: Man dies in car crash inside Phoenix airport parking garage
description: A man died after crashing his car against a wall on the roof level of the Phoenix airport parking garage. Authorities are still investigating the cause of the fatal crash.

title: Maryland's highest court was 1 vote short of rejecting state legislative map
description: Three of seven MD judges opposed the majority ruling of a state legislative district map last April. Republican plaintiffs alleged that some districts were irregularly shaped.

title: Border Patrol chief says agents caught 10 illegal immigrant sex offenders in 3 days: ‘The dangers are real'
description: Border Patrol Chief Raul Ortiz announced that agents have caught 10 sex offenders, as well as gang members and a murderer coming across the southern border.

title: WH appears to send mixed messages on 'MAGA Republicans,' stating it's not 'most' GOP, but party is 'overrun'
description: The Biden administration has simultaneously claimed that the Republican Party has been taken over by extremists, and also that most Republicans are not among them.

title: Rafael Nadal suggests taking time away after US Open loss: 'I don't know when I am going to come back'
description: 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal suggested he may take time away after losing in the fourth round of the U.S. Open on Monday night to Frances Tiafoe.

title: 2 killed, 1 injured in separate Utah hiking accidents
description: Three separate hiking accidents occurred in Utah over the Labor Day weekend. Two men fell to their deaths, and one woman lost consciousness in the mountains.

title: 'Fox News Sunday' on August 21, 2022
description: 'Fox News Sunday' hosts Republican Governor Chris Sununu of New Hampshire and U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm to discuss economic policy and more.

description: "Fox News Sunday" welcomed USA Today Washington bureau chief Susan Page, Fox News contributors Jonathan Turley and Jason Riley, Gen.Jack Keane, and more.

title: White House press secretary grilled on tweet calling 2016 election 'stolen'

title: 2 Virginia school board candidates drop out of race after laughing at autistic student
description: Two Virginia school board candidates dropped out of the race after being captured on video laughing at an autistic student who sang the national anthem.

title: Wolf recaptured after escaping Ohio zoo
description: A wolf that escaped its enclosure at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo in Ohio has been recaptured. No guests or zoo employees were harmed during the incident.

title: Texas head coach Steve Sarkisian on facing No. 1 Alabama: ‘We need to be enamored with us
description: Texas head coach Steve Sarkisian told reporters Monday that he wants his team focused on playing 'good football' and not worried about the big stage of playing Alabama.

title: Tropical Storm Earl expected to become hurricane
description: Tropical Storm Earl was swirling around 345 miles north of St.Thomas on Tuesday morning. The storm is forecast to strengthen into a hurricane over the Atlantic.

description: 'Laptop from Hell' author Miranda Devine weighed in on President Biden's ties to his son Hunter's business dealings on Brian Kilmeade's radio show Tuesday.

title: Chinese residents prevented from fleeing earthquake due to COVID-19 lockdowns sparks outrage: report
description: Social media users expressed outrage over videos purportedly showing Chinese residents trapped in their apartments during an earthquake because of coronavirus lockdowns.

title: Utah small town's lone police officer alleges he was fired for giving mayor's son a traffic ticket: report
description: The ex-police chief of Moroni, Utah, alleges in a new lawsuit that he was fired for issuing a traffic ticket to the mayor's son, as the city contracts out for part-time patrols.

title: Truck hauling luxury vehicles crashes in North Carolina
description: A crash in North Carolina, caused by a blown tire on a truck hauling luxury vehicles, started a fire on Interstate 95. Portions of the road were closed between Four Oaks and Benson.

title: NYC public schools eliminate snow days, will go virtual during bad weather
description: The New York City Department of Education announced that inclement weather and snow will no longer cancel classes for students at city public schools.

description: The Biden White House appointed former Hillary Clinton campaign manager John Podesta as senior climate adviser on Friday, sparking social media outrage.

title: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers calls for $2 billion increase in funding for public schools
description: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers has called for a nearly $2 billion increase in spending for public schools. This plan was released nine weeks before Evers looks to be reelected.

title: 'Twilight' actor Peter Facinelli and Lily Anne Harrison welcome their first baby together
description: Peter Facinelli and Lily Anne Harrison announced the birth of their baby with a post shared by Facinelli. This is his fourth child. He has three daughters with ex-wife Jennie Garth.

description: A massive 6.8 magnitude earthquake near the Tibetan Plateau in Sichuan, China has claimed the lives of at least 66 people and leveled residences.

description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers spoke highly of the rookie wide receivers last week. Green Bay drafted three receivers in the 2022 NFL Draft.

title: Margaret Court takes aim at Serena Williams, tennis community: 'I don’t think she has ever admired me'
description: 24-time Grand Slam champion Margaret Court took aim at Serena Williams after her U.S. Open exit, saying she believes she never "admired me."

description: Thomas E. Ricks revealed in a Monday op-ed that the "prognosis" for America is improving and that he is far less concerned about a second civil war today.

title: Biden's student loan handout will exacerbate exploding college costs
description: Instead of improving access and affordability, taxpayers are subsidizing a tuition spending race that has made college less affordable and less accessible.

description: Shohei Ohtani and Mike Trout combined for three home runs in the Los Angeles Angels' 10-0 win over the Detroit Tigers on Monday night in southern California.

title: Canada mass stabbing: One suspect found dead; brother remains at large

description: Employees at an Atlanta Popeyes called the police on a woman trying to buy food for a homeless man. Jo Ortega recorded the interaction and posted it to TikTok where it went viral.

title: ‘Boy Meets World’ star Maitland Ward explains why she left Hollywood: ‘I'm now my authentic self'
description: Maitland Ward has written a new memoir in which she opened up about her adult film career after cosplaying. She had her start in Hollywood with "The Bold and the Beautiful."

description: Democrats have started to reframe school reopening policies across the country, arguing it was Republicans who opposed efforts leading to students returning to in-person instruction.

description: Claudia Romo Edelman is the creative leader behind Hispanic Star, a new biography series for kids that spotlights Latino heroes. Fox News Digital spoke with her about its genesis.

title: California judge from a powerful Democratic family declares mistrial for sleepy robbery defendant
description: A Los Angeles judge from a prominent Democratic family declared a mistrial last week for a robbery defendant who said he hadn't had a good night's sleep, court records show.

description: If Monday was the foreshadowing of what the Arizona Diamondback's Ryne Nelson and Houston Astros' Hunter Brown can do in the big leagues, then the future of these young men is certainly bright.

title: On this day in history, Sept. 6, 1757, Marquis de Lafayette is born, hero of two revolutions
description: The Marquis de Lafayette, known as the hero of two revolutions, arrived in the United States at age 19 to serve alongside George Washington and then helped inspire the French Revolution.

title: California wildfire explodes to 500 acres in one hour, evacuations ordered
description: The Fairview fire exploded to over 500 acres in about one hour on Monday, forcing evacuations in parts of East Hemet, California, according to Cal Fire.

title: Bo Bichette blasts three homers in game two to cap doubleheader sweep over Orioles
description: Bo Bichette blasted three home runs in game two of the Blue Jays' doubleheader against the Orioles, all but guaranteeing a sweep over Baltimore on the day.

title: Russian troops in Ukraine facing 'morale and discipline' issues due to problems with pay, UK says
description: As Putin seeks to replenish troops in Ukraine, forces that are already there are suffering "morale and discipline issues" due to issues with pay, the UK says.

title: Eliza Fletcher abduction: 'deceased party' found near area of crime scene investigation
description: The Memphis Police Department said on Monday it had located a "deceased party" near where Eliza Fletcher was abducted while jogging last Friday.

title: Jack Flaherty solid in return, but Cardinals bullpen falters in 6-0 loss to Nationals
description: Jack Flaherty allowed just one run in five innings of work in his first start since June 26, but the St. Louis Cardinals fell to the Washington Nationals, 6-0.

title: Bears' Matt Eberflus on head coaching debut: 'It's always special when you do something for the first time'
description: Matt Eberflus has been coaching football in some capacity for 30 years, but the former Tulane student assistant finally got his first NFL head coaching gig.
